sen.e: Akiteru KAJUJI (January 11, 1815 to February 10, 1861) was a court noble in the late Edo period.
Akiteru KASHUJI (January 11, 1815 - February 10, 1861) was a Kugyo (court noble) in the late Edo Period.

sen.j: 子供のいなかった勧修寺経則（俊明の甥）の養子となり、文政7年（1824年）2月に元服・昇殿、天保元年（1830年）に侍従となる。
sen.e: Akiteru was adopted to Tsunenori KAJUJI (Toshiaki BOJO's nephew), who didn't have his own child, and celebrated his coming of age and entered the imperial court in February 1824 (the 7th year in Bunsei era), and became Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) in 1830.

Akiteru was adopted by Tsunetoki KASHUJI (a nephew of Toshiaki BOJO) who had no biological child, and entered Imperial Court in March 1824 after he had his coming of age ceremony, and became Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) in 1831.
sen.cmt: 政7年2月は西暦1824年3月です。天保元年は原文では1830年ですが、変換ツールでは1831年です。1831に変更しました。
sen.e: Akiteru was adopted by Tsunetoki KASHUJI (a nephew of Toshiaki BOJO) who had no biological child, and entered Imperial Court in March 1824 after he had his coming of age ceremony, and became Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) in 1831.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、後に養父・経則に阿固丸（後の穂波経治）・稲丸（後の勧修寺経理）が誕生する。
sen.e: However, afterwards, Akiteru's adopted father,Tunenori's biological sons, Akomaru (later Tsuneharu HONAMI) and Inemaru (later Tsuneosa KAJUJI) were born.
sen.cmt: 経治の読み方が不明です。（Tsuneharuとしています。）

sen.j: 顕彰は実子の孟丸（後の穂波経度）に家督を継がせたいとして考え、天保7年（1836年）の養父の死後も経則の遺志に従ってその子から後継者を選びたいとする家臣たちと対立した。
sen.e: Since Akiteru wanted to make his biological son, Takemaru, the heir to the Kajuji's estate, he confronted with some vassals; they wanted one of Tsunenori's biological sons to succeed the estate based on the will left by Tsunenori, who passed away in 1836 (the 7th year of Tempo era).

As Akiteru wanted to make his biological son, Takemaru (later Tsunenori HONAMI), the heir to the reigns of the Kashuji family, confrontation was raised between him and some vassals who wanted one of the Tsunetoki's biological sons to be an heir to abide by the will left by Tsunenori who died in 1836.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: As Akiteru wanted to make his biological son, Takemaru (later Tsunenori HONAMI), the heir to the reigns of the Kashuji family, confrontation was raised between him and some vassals who wanted one of the Tsunetoki's biological sons to be an heir to abide by the will left by Tsunenori who died in 1836.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 最終的に仁孝天皇の尚侍であった勧修寺徳子（勧修寺経逸の娘、坊城俊明の妹）らが間に入る形で、阿古丸を穂波家の養子として同家を継がせ、孟丸をその養子とすることとし、天保10年に稲丸が授爵されて後継者に定められた。
sen.e: Finally, thanks to the intervention of Tokuko KAJUJI (Tsunehaya KAJUJI's daughter as well as Toshiaki BOJO's younger sister), Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid) of Emperor Ninko, and others, the problem was settled in the following way: Akomaru was adopted to the Honami family to succeed to its estate and he would adopt Takemaru; Inamaru was granted a title and admitted as a successor to the Kajuji family in 1839 (the tenth year of Tempo era).

In the end, the successor problem was settled by Nariko KASHUJI (a daughter of Tsunehaya KASHUJI and a younger sister of Toshiaki BOJO), Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid) of Emperor Ninko, and others: Akomaru was adopted by the Honami family to become the heir and adopted Takemaru, and Inamaru was admitted as an heir to the Kashuji family in 1839 as he was conferred a peerage.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the end, the successor problem was settled by Nariko KASHUJI (a daughter of Tsunehaya KASHUJI and a younger sister of Toshiaki BOJO), Naishi no Kami (Principal Handmaid) of Emperor Ninko, and others: Akomaru was adopted by the Honami family to become the heir and adopted Takemaru, and Inamaru was admitted as an heir to the Kashuji family in 1839 as he was conferred a peerage.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この過程で顕彰が対立した家臣を追放したこと、天保の大飢饉（収入の減少及び物価高騰）や勧修寺家が務めていた寺社伝奏の職務不振によって財政が逼迫してきたこと、前述の後継者問題などで宮廷内に強い影響力を持つ叔母・徳子と不仲となったことで心身に支障をきたすようになった。
sen.e: Akinori became weak physically and mentally, by having expelled the vassals who confronted with him, facing financial problems caused by the Tenpo Famine (causing decreased income and price runup) and poorly-performing 'denso (job title to relay messages of court's people to Emperor)' of the Kajuji family for temples and shrines, and by having a falling-out with his aunt, Tokuko, who was influential in the Imperial Court, as shown in the successor problem mentioned above.

During the settlement process, Akiteru suffered from mental unsoundness as he had to deal with several problems such as expelling opponent vassals, financial tightness caused by the Tempo Famine (triggered decrease in income and price run-up) and decline of the opportunity to perform the work of Jisha Tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and temples and shrines), the government post that the family had been in charge of, and the friction with his aunt, Nariko, who had a great influence in the Imperial Court caused by the successor problem.
sen.cmt: Akinori -> Akiteru後列で顕彰がAkinoriになっていたため修正しました。職務不振：寺社伝奏の職務遂行の機会が減少した と解釈しました。 寺社伝奏の訳はWeb用語集の武家伝奏を参照しました
sen.e: During the settlement process, Akiteru suffered from mental unsoundness as he had to deal with several problems such as expelling opponent vassals, financial tightness caused by the Tempo Famine (triggered decrease in income and price run-up) and decline of the opportunity to perform the work of Jisha Tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and temples and shrines), the government post that the family had been in charge of, and the friction with his aunt, Nariko, who had a great influence in the Imperial Court caused by the successor problem.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天保14年（1843年）に顕彰は勧修寺家歴代が補任されてきた蔵人に任じられたものの、彼を取り巻く諸問題が尾を引いた結果、弘化3年（1846年）秋の放生会での「御混乱」をきっかけに「所労」を理由に自宅に引き籠ってしまったのである（袖岡文景（勧修寺家雑掌）『山城国京都袖岡玄蕃助家記』弘化4年2月14日条）。
sen.e: Although Akinori was appointed to be 'Kurodo (Chamberlain),' which the Kanjuji clan had been successively appointed, he shut himself off from the job and the society, saying that he was 'exhausted and sick'; various problems surrounding him lingered, and 'the Disorder' at 'Hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings)' in the autumn of 1846 (the third year of Koka era), was the last blow. ("The family record by Genbanosuke YUOKA in Yamashiro Province of KYoto"(written on February 14, the 4th year of Koka era) written by Fumikage Yuoka. 'Zassho (a person in charge of miscellaneous task)')

Although Akiteru was appointed to Kurodo (Chamberlain), the government post the Kashuji family had been successively appointed to, he shut himself off from the public, saying that he was 'exhausted and sick' from the lingering various problems surrounding him after showing 'behavioral disorder' at 'Hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings)' in the autumn of 1846. (The section of February 14, the 4th year of Koka era in "Yamashiro no Kuni Kyoto SODEOKA Genbanosuke Kaki" [The Family Chronicle of Genbanosuke SODEOKA in Kyoto, Yamashiro Province] written by Fumikage SODEOKA [a Zassho [or Karei: butler] of the Kashuji family]).
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Although Akiteru was appointed to Kurodo (Chamberlain), the government post the Kashuji family had been successively appointed to, he shut himself off from the public, saying that he was 'exhausted and sick' from the lingering various problems surrounding him after showing 'behavioral disorder' at 'Hojoe (the ritual for releasing living beings)' in the autumn of 1846. (The section of February 14, the 4th year of Koka era in "Yamashiro no Kuni Kyoto SODEOKA Genbanosuke Kaki" [The Family Chronicle of Genbanosuke SODEOKA in Kyoto, Yamashiro Province] written by Fumikage SODEOKA [a Zassho [or Karei: butler] of the Kashuji family]).

sen.j: 翌年の正月には酒に酔った上に訪問中の客人に対して刀を向けるという事件を引き起こし、更に同年に行われた孝明天皇の即位礼にも出仕しなかった。
sen.e: At New Year's in the next year (1847, the fourth year Koka era), Akinori was drunk and put a sword toward a guest; he didn't attend the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Komei, which was held in the same year.

During the New Year of 1847, the next year, Akiteru was drunk and escalated into violence as to point his sword at his guest, and moreover, he didn't attend the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Komei, which was held in the same year.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: During the New Year of 1847, the next year, Akiteru was drunk and escalated into violence as to point his sword at his guest, and moreover, he didn't attend the enthronement ceremony of Emperor Komei, which was held in the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、関白鷹司政通の怒りを買い、同年10月には蔵人を、12月には左少弁などの兼職を全て解任されて失脚した（表向きは自発的辞退）。
sen.e: That made Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), furious and Akinori was dismissed from Kurodo on October, 1848 and from other concurrent jobs including Sashoben (third-ranked officer of the left) on December. (Officially, he was recorded to submit his letter of resignation voluntarily.)

His discourtesy made Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), furious and Akiteru was dismissed from Kurodo in November 1847 and from other posts including Sashoben (Minor Controller of the Left) in January 1848. (The official record reads that he tendered his letter of resignation voluntarily.)
sen.cmt: 弘化4年10月は西暦1847年11月です。弘化4年12月は西暦1848年1月です。左少弁は他のファイルに右少弁があるため、補足説明を合わせました。
sen.e: His discourtesy made Masamichi TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), furious and Akiteru was dismissed from Kurodo in November 1847 and from other posts including Sashoben (Minor Controller of the Left) in January 1848. (The official record reads that he tendered his letter of resignation voluntarily.)
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ただし、顕彰自身は蔵人の仕事自体には意欲を持ち、静養の後に復職したいという希望はもっていたらしく、実父の坊城俊明と相談して一旦蔵人の辞表を提出したものの、そのまま解任となり、「仰天嘆息之外無之者也」（『顕彰日記』弘化4年10月12・13日条）と書き記している。
sen.e: However, Akinori was interested in the job of Kurodo and wanted to return to the job and he wrote 'all I can do is to sigh and lament over the past' in his diary (written on 12 and 13 of October, 1853 (Koka 4) in "Akinori Diary"); he submitted his letter of resignation in consultation with his biological father, Toshiaki BOJO; although he secretly hoped that his resignation would not be accepted or would be given a chance to come back to the positionhe, he was dismissed.

Akiteru had his will to return to the post of Kurodo after the recuperation, so he tendered his letter of resignation over consultation with his biological father, Toshiaki BOJO; although he secretly hoped that his resignation would not be accepted or would be given a chance to come back to the position, he was dismissed and he wrote 'all I can do is to sigh and lament over the past' in his diary (the section of twelfth and thirteenth of October, the fourth year of Koka era of "Akiteru Diary").
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。

sen.j: その後、許されて安政4年（1857年）10月に左中弁に任ぜられ、廷臣八十八卿列参事件には養子・経理及び実子の穂波経度とともに加わっている。
sen.e: Afterwards, he was forgiven and appointed to 'Sachuben (middle controller of the left)' and participated in 'Teishin hachiju-hachi kyo ressan jiken (Demo of eighty-eight retainers of Imperial Court)' together with his adopted child Tsuneosa, and biological child, Tsunetada HONAMI..
